items.text: good line - outside off, and an excellent length, which doesn't give the batsman any room to send it past the point fielder
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: Pitched up on off this time, and it's a chance missed perhaps; the drive goes only as far as mid-off and they scamper across for a quick single
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: angled in this time, and Ambris gets it away to deep square-leg for a single this time
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: slight misfield by the midwicket fielder, who dives over the ball to let this flick from Hope - angled in again from Mashrafe - go for a single
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: shorter outside off from Mashrafe, and it's dabbed away for a single to third man
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.preText: No bowling changes yet. Saifuddin continues.
items.text: back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: length ball close to off stump, stays on the back foot and waits, and taps down on top of the bounce to guide it into the gap to the left of backward point
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: shot! That's brilliant from Hope. Saifuddin drifts onto the pads and thinks to himself, damn, that's going for four. Nope. Hope flicks it away, and times it so well that it carries all the way over the backward square leg boundary
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, SIX runs

items.text: on the pads again, a little shorter, clipped to the left of short fine leg
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, nips back in towards off and middle as he tries to stay leg-side of the ball to guide it down to third man, as he likes to do. Ambris is instead forced to play a defensive punch to mid-off
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: full on middle stump, chipped away over wide mid-on, and they run three by the time deep square leg makes the long journey to his left
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, 3 runs

items.preText:
Arzoo : "This is very good and sensible batting from WI, even though both bowlers are consistently bowling good and tight lengths still they are rotating strikes by singles and odd boundaries when available! Contrary to Tiger batters who waits for boundary balls instead of rotating strikes and hence creates self pressure!" -- You're underrating Bangladesh's batting there!

Mashur: "Bangladesh is bowling very tightly since the last Asia Cup. They badly need to continue this run to acheive something big in the World Cup"
items.text: length ball angling into middle stump, shows the full face for a push down the ground, to the left of mid-on. Mashrafe does the chasing himself
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, keeps a bit low. Hope is jumping and crouching all at once, punches to the left of mid-on. They start running, and then turn back when the fielder makes an excellent diving save
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: good length, a bit too much width, flat-batted up and over the gap to the left of mid-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball, fourth-stump line, punched to the right of deep cover point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 2 runs

items.text: back of a length, nips in slightly towards off stump, punched to short extra-cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: shortish on off stump, hops to ride the bounce and defend towards backward point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.preText: First bowling change, here's Mustafizur Rahman from left-arm over. A wide gully in place.
items.text: back of a length on off stump, looks for that late dab again to third man. and gully throws himself to his right to intercept
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Ambris, no run

items.text: shortish on off stump, and he jumps on that slight error in length, opens up at the hips and swats it away through the vacant midwicket region - big gap there to enable that fielder at gully
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.text: bouncer, gets up to chest height on off stump, sways away from the line
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Ambris, no run

items.text: overpitched, lots of width, and Ambris hardly has to move his feet to clatter that over mid-off
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.preText: Mid-off drops back to long-off, not sure who's moved in
items.text: four more, that's the third of the over. Short now, not a bad ball, gets up around the left shoulder, but Ambris deals with it beautifully, swivels and rolls his wrists over on top of the bounce to keep it down and find the gap to the right of deep square leg
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.text: another bouncer, this one's angling away outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Ambris, no run

items.preText:
Spin for the first time, here's Mosaddek Hossain.


Anwar: "Out of 11 players in Bangladesh team, eight of them has name starts with the letter "M"."
items.text: tossed up full on middle and off, driven to long-on
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, not too far outside off, makes a bit of room and slaps to extra-cover
items.shortText: Mosaddek Hossain to Ambris, no run
